workflow.name: Generate event badges with QR codes, HTMLCSStoImage, Gmail & Google Sheets
workflow.description:
# Automated Event Badge Generator

Streamline your event registration process with this fully automated badge generation system. Perfect for conferences, seminars, corporate events, universities, and training programs.

## üéØ What This Workflow Does

1. **Receives Registration Data** via webhook (POST request)
2. **Validates & Sanitizes** attendee information (email, name, role)
3. **Generates Unique QR Codes** for each attendee with scannable IDs
4. **Creates Beautiful HTML Badges** with gradient design and branding
5. **Converts to High-Quality PNG Images** (400x680px) via HTMLCSStoImage API
6. **Logs Everything** to Google Sheets for tracking and analytics
7. **Sends Personalized Emails** with badge attachment and event instructions
8. **Handles Errors Gracefully** with admin notifications

## ‚ú® Key Features

- **Professional Badge Design**: Gradient purple background, attendee photos (initials), QR codes
- **Automatic QR Code Generation**: Unique scannable codes for quick check-in
- **Email Delivery**: Personalized HTML emails with download links
- **Google Sheets Tracking**: Complete audit trail of all badge generations
- **Error Handling**: Admin alerts when generation fails
- **Scalable**: Process registrations one-by-one or in batches

## üîß Required Setup

### APIs & Credentials:
1. **HTMLCSStoImg API** - 
   - Sign up at https://htmlcsstoimg.com
   - Get API Key

2. **Gmail OAuth2**
   - Connect your Gmail account
   - Grant send permissions

3. **Google Sheets OAuth2**
   - Create a tracking spreadsheet
   - Add headers: Name, Email, Event, Role, Attendee ID, Badge URL, Timestamp
   - Connect via OAuth2

### Before Activation:
- Replace `YOUR_GOOGLE_SHEETS_ID` with your Google Sheet ID
- Replace `admin@example.com` with your admin email address
- Add all three credentials
- Test with sample data

## üìä Use Cases

- **Conferences & Seminars**: Generate badges for 100+ attendees
- **Universities**: Student ID cards and event passes
- **Corporate Events**: Employee badges with QR check-in
- **Training Programs**: Course participant badges
- **Workshops**: Professional badges with role identification
- **Trade Shows**: Exhibitor and visitor badges

## üé® Customization Options

- **Badge Design**: Modify HTML/CSS for custom branding, colors, logos
- **QR Code Size**: Adjust dimensions for different use cases
- **Email Template**: Personalize welcome message and instructions
- **Role-Based Badges**: Different designs for VIP, Speaker, Staff, Attendee
- **Multi-Event Support**: Handle multiple events with different templates

## üìà What You'll Track

- Total badges generated
- Attendee names, emails, roles
- Badge image URLs for reprints
- Generation timestamps
- Event names and dates

## ‚ö° Processing Time

- **Average**: 5-8 seconds per badge
- **Includes**: Validation, QR generation, HTML rendering, image conversion, logging, email

## üîí Security Features

- Email format validation
- Continue-on-fail error handling
- Admin notifications on failures
- Secure credential storage

## üí° Pro Tips

- Use a dedicated Gmail account for automation
- Monitor HTMLCSStoImg API limits
- Create separate sheets for different events
- Archive old data periodically
- Set up webhook authentication for production

## üöÄ Getting Started

1. Import this workflow
2. Add the three required credentials
3. Update Sheet ID and admin email
4. Test with sample registration data
5. Activate and integrate with your registration form

Perfect for event organizers, HR teams, universities, and anyone managing events with 10-1000+ attendees!

---

parameters.content:
## SETUP CREDENTIALS FIRST

**üîê HTMLCSStoImage API**
‚Ä¢ Sign up: https://htmlcsstoimg.com
‚Ä¢ Get API credentials from dashboard
‚Ä¢ Add to n8n: Basic Auth credential

**üìß Gmail OAuth2**
‚Ä¢ Select: "Gmail OAuth2 API"
‚Ä¢ Connect your Gmail account
‚Ä¢ Grant send permissions

**üìä Google Sheets API**  
‚Ä¢ Select: "Google Sheets OAuth2"
‚Ä¢ Authenticate with Google
‚Ä¢ Grant read/write access

**Test each credential before running the workflow**


**üí° Pro Tips:**
‚Ä¢ Use a dedicated Gmail for automation
‚Ä¢ Create a new Sheet for each event
‚Ä¢ Monitor API rate limits

## ERROR HANDLING

Triggered when badge generation fails

Sends admin alert with:
- Full attendee details
- Attendee ID
- Timestamp
- Possible failure causes
- Action items

To: admin@example.com

Next steps:
- Check API status
- Review logs
- Retry manually

## STEP 9: SEND BADGE EMAIL

Sends via Gmail with:
- Personalized HTML email
- Badge download link
- Event instructions
- Check-in details
- Contact information

To: Attendee email
Attachment: Badge PNG from URL

Continue on fail: ON

## STEP 8: EXTRACT BADGE URL

Extracts image URL from API response

Returns clean data:
- binary file named badge

Used for: Logging & email

## STEP 6: CONDITIONAL LOGIC

CONDITIONAL CHECK

Verifies badge generation success

Condition: {{ $json.image_url }} is not empty

TRUE (Green):
‚Üí Badge generated successfully
‚Üí Continue to email delivery

FALSE (Red):
‚Üí Generation failed
‚Üí Send error alert to admin

## STEP 5: BUILD HTML BADGE

Uses HTMLCSStoImage AP

Sends:
- Full HTML code
- Viewport: 400x680px

Returns: Image URL

Auth: Basic Auth with API credentials

Continue on fail: ON

## STEP 4: PREPARE QR URL

Converts binary QR to accessible URL

Creates URL:
https://api.qrserver.com/...?data=ATD-XXX

Used for: Embedding in HTML badge template

## STEP 3: QR CODE GENERATION

Creates QR code via qrserver.com API

Parameters:
- Size: 300x300px
- Data: Attendee ID
- Format: PNG image

Output: Binary QR code file

Continue on fail: ON

## STEP 2: DATA VALIDATION

Operations:
‚úì Validates email format
‚úì Checks name exists
‚úì Generates unique attendee ID
‚úì Capitalizes name properly
‚úì Extracts initials (2 letters)
‚úì Normalizes email to lowercase
‚úì Sets default event/role if missing
‚úì Adds timestamp

Throws error if:
- Email invalid
- Name missing

## STEP 1: WEBHOOK TRIGGER

**Test with cURL:**
```bash
curl -X POST https://your-n8n.com/webhook/admissio
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{
    "name": "Jane Smith",
    "email": "your-email@gmail.com",
    "event": "TechCon 2025",
    "role": "VIP Speaker"
}'
```

## WORKFLOW OVERVIEW

**Purpose:** Automated event badge generation system

**Processing Time:** 5-8 seconds end-to-end

**Workflow Steps:**
1. Receive registration data via webhook (POST)
2. Validate email and format inputs
3. Generate unique QR code with attendee ID
4. Create custom HTML badge design
5. Convert HTML to downloadable PNG
6. Log all data to Google Sheets
7. Send badge via email with instructions

**Success Path:**
‚úÖ Valid data ‚Üí Badge generated ‚Üí Email sent

**Error Path:**
‚ùå Invalid data ‚Üí Workflow stopped ‚Üí Error logged

**Perfect For:**
‚Ä¢ Universities & colleges
‚Ä¢ Corporate events
‚Ä¢ Conferences & seminars
‚Ä¢ Training programs

parameters.message:
=

‚ö†Ô∏è Badge Generation Failed

A badge generation request has failed.

Attendee Details:

Name: {{ $('Validate & Sanitize').item.json.name }}
Email: {{ $('Validate & Sanitize').item.json.email }}
Event: {{ $('Validate & Sanitize').item.json.event }}
Role: {{ $('Validate & Sanitize').item.json.role }}
Attendee ID: {{ $('Validate & Sanitize').item.json.attendeeId }}
Timestamp: {{ $('Validate & Sanitize').item.json.timestamp }}

Possible Causes:

  • HTMLCSStoImage API is down or rate limited
  • API credentials expired or invalid
  • Network connectivity issues
  • Invalid HTML in badge template

Action Required:

  1. Check n8n workflow execution logs
  2. Verify HTMLCSStoImage API status
  3. Manually regenerate badge for this attendee
  4. Contact attendee if urgent

Workflow Name: Event Badge Generator

n8n Instance: n8n.mediajade.com
parameters.subject: ‚ö†Ô∏è Badge Generation Failed

parameters.message:
=

üéâ Your Event Badge is Ready!

Welcome to {{ $json.Event }}

Hello {{ $json.Name }},

Great news! Your personalized event badge for {{ $json.Event }} has been generated successfully.

üìã Your Badge Details

Name: {{ $json.Name }}
Role: {{ $json.Role }}
Attendee ID: {{ $json['Attendee ID'] }}
Event: {{ $json.Event }}
üì• Download Your Badge

üìå Important Instructions:

  • Download your badge using the button above
  • Print it in color on standard paper OR save it on your phone
  • Present your badge at the event entrance for check-in
  • The QR code on your badge will be scanned for quick entry

Event Details:

  • üìÖ Date: October 25-27, 2025
  • üìç Venue: Convention Center
  • üïê Check-in: Opens 8:00 AM daily

If you have any questions or need assistance, please reply to this email or contact our support team.

We look forward to seeing you at the event! üéä

Best regards,
TechCon 2025 Team

This is an automated email. Please do not reply to this message.

¬© 2025 TechCon. All rights reserved.

parameters.content:
## STEP 9: LOG TO GOOGLE SHEETS

Appends row to tracking sheet:
- Name
- Email
- Event
- Role
- Attendee ID
- Badge URL
- Timestamp

Sheet: Event Badge Tracker
Continue on fail: ON

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
